item.title: With violent rhetoric, Trump targets electric vehicles in effort to defeat Biden in Michigan
item.dc:creator: Allan Smith and Yamiche Alcindor and Mark Murray and Olympia Sonnier
item.description: Trump has warned that Biden's policies encouraging the transition to electric vehicles would result in an economic “bloodbath” in the U.S. economy that would “kill” the auto industry.

media:content.media:text: politics political politician ev electric vehicle Hummer GM profile smile happy
media:content.media:description: Encouraging the transition to electric vehicles has been a major part of President Joe Biden's agenda.

item.title: Crumbley parents will face school shooting victims' families at sentencing
item.dc:creator: Selina Guevara and Maggie Vespa and Erik Ortiz
item.description: The first parents to ever be charged, then convicted, in their child's mass shooting at a U.S. school are expected to face the victims during a sentencing hearing in a Michigan courtroom.

media:content.media:text: Jennifer and James Crumbley, the parents of Ethan Crumbley, a teenager accused of killing four students in a shooting at Oxford High School, appear in court for a preliminary examination on involuntary manslaughter charges in Rochester Hills, Mich., on Feb. 8, 2022.
media:content.media:description: Jennifer and James Crumbley, the parents of Ethan Crumbley, appear in court for a preliminary examination on involuntary manslaughter charges in Rochester Hills, Mich., on Feb. 8, 2022.

media:content.media:text: A side by side of Jennifer and James Crumbley in court.
media:content.media:description: Jennifer and James Crumbley.

item.title: Special counsel Jack Smith urges Supreme Court to reject Trump's presidential immunity claim
item.dc:creator: Ryan J. Reilly and Megan Lebowitz and Ken Dilanian
item.description: In a court filing ahead of April 25 arguments, Smith laid out a series of arguments against Trump’s claim that a president has “absolute immunity” from criminal prosecution.

media:content.media:text: Jack Smith speaks at a press conference
media:content.media:description: Jack Smith speaks at a news conference in Washington on June 9.

item.title: UConn defeats Purdue 75-60 to become the first back-to-back NCAA champions in 17 years
item.description: The top-seeded Purdue will face defending champions UConn for tonight's championship title. The game starts at 9:20 p.m. ET.

media:content.media:text: Image: UConn wins happy celebration
media:content.media:description: UConn players celebrate as time expires during the second half of the NCAA college Final Four championship basketball game against Purdue, in Glendale, Ariz., on April 8, 2024.

item.title: The states where private equity has the most sway over housing, health care, jobs and pensions
item.dc:creator: Gretchen Morgenson
item.description: A new study by Private Equity Stakeholder Project identifies the states where private-equity firms have the most influence over health care, housing, jobs and pensions.

media:content.media:description: Tenants have endured significant rent increases in Atlanta, according to Alison Johnson of the Housing Justice League.

item.title: Why are dermatologists prescribing women a blood pressure drug for acne?
item.dc:creator: Marina Kopf
item.description: According to a study in JAMA Dermatology, the prescribing rates of spironolactone for acne in women rose about 300% from 2017 to 2020.

media:content.media:text: Photo Illustration: A woman with acne and a hand holding a round pill tablet
media:content.media:description: The prescribing rates of spironolactone for acne in women rose about 300% from 2017 to 2020, one study found.

media:content.media:text: Before and after JJ Boparai started taking spironolactone to treat her acne.
media:content.media:description: Before and after JJ Boparai started taking spironolactone to treat her acne.

item.title: Watch emotional moments as skywatchers view solar eclipse
item.description: A total solar eclipse — nicknamed the Great North American Eclipse for its long path over North America — was visible in the sky over parts of Mexico, 15 U.S. states and eastern Canada. Watch a roundup of stunning moments from the people watching the eclipse, and the eclipse itself.

media:content.media:title: Watch emotional moments as skywatchers view solar eclipse
media:content.media:description: A total solar eclipse — nicknamed the Great North American Eclipse for its long path over North America — was visible in the sky over parts of Mexico, 15 U.S. states and eastern Canada. Watch a roundup of stunning moments from the people watching the eclipse, and the eclipse itself.

item.title: Election worker turnover has reached historic highs ahead of the 2024 vote, new data shows
item.dc:creator: Jane C. Timm
item.description: Election officials across the country are leaving their jobs at the highest rates in decades ahead of the 2024 presidential contest.

media:content.media:credit: Elijah Nouvelage for The Washington Post via Getty Images
media:content.media:text: People line up to vote in Cobb County, Marietta, Ga., on Saturday, Nov. 26, 2022.
media:content.media:description: People line up to vote in Marietta, Ga., on Nov. 26, 2022.

item.title: A typically French disruption threatens a key part of the Olympics as medal-makers go on strike
item.dc:creator: Alexander Smith and Nancy Ing and The Associated Press
item.description: Paris 2024 Olympics medals are the subject of French strike action after workers at the country's national mint protested over pay ahead of the summer Games.

media:content.media:text: Paris 2024 Olympic medals.
media:content.media:description: Paris 2024 Olympic medals in Saint-Denis, France, on Feb. 8, 2024.

item.title: Lawyer fatally shoots ex-daughter-in law, fellow attorney in Las Vegas law firm
item.dc:creator: Andrew Blankstein and Antonio Planas
item.description: A lawyer fatally shot his former daughter-in-law, as well as a fellow attorney, during a deposition at a Las Vegas law firm Monday morning, two sources familiar with the investigation said.

item.title: Gadi Schwartz previews eclipse coverage in the sky
item.description: Gadi Schwartz previews NBC News’ solar eclipse coverage up in the air over Texas.

media:content.media:title: Gadi Schwartz previews eclipse coverage in the sky
media:content.media:description: Gadi Schwartz previews NBC News’ solar eclipse coverage up in the air over Texas.

item.title: 'Hey Jude' is out, 'Anti-Hero' is just right: Chechnya bans songs deemed too fast or too slow
item.dc:creator: Yuliya Talmazan
item.description: Taylor Swift, Beyoncé and even The Beatles’ back catalog could be off playlists in Chechnya after the Russian republic instituted limits on musical tempo.

media:content.media:text: Ramzan Kadyrov dances.
media:content.media:description: Ramzan Kadyrov with a Chechen girl dressed in a national costume in Grozny, Russia in 2007.

item.title: Idaho teen arrested and accused of planning to kill churchgoers in the name of ISIS
item.dc:creator: Patrick Smith
item.description: An Idaho teenager was arrested and accused of planning to kill churchgoers during services across his hometown in the name of the Islamic State group, authorities have said.

media:content.media:text: Coeur d'Alene.
media:content.media:description: Downtown Coeur d'Alene, Idaho.

item.title: Crumbley parents to be sentenced and Las Vegas law office shooting: Morning Rundown
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Robinson
item.description: Crumbley parents sentenced for son's school shooting. Attorney kills ex-daughter-in-law in Las Vegas deposition. Trump is blasted by conservatives after failing to take a stance on a national abortion ban.

media:content.media:text: Donald Trump,Lindsey Graham

item.title: China's Xi meets with Russian Foreign Minister Lavrov in show of support against Western democracies
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping met with Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov on Tuesday in a sign of mutual support and shared opposition to Western democracies amid Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine.

media:content.media:text: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, left, shakes hands with Chinese State Councilor and Foreign Minister Wang Yi.
media:content.media:description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, left, shakes hands with Chinese State Councilor and Foreign Minister Wang Yi on April 24, 2018 in Beijing, China.

item.title: Trial opens in Thailand for the son of Spanish actors over the killing of a Colombian surgeon
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Thailand’s court began a trial Tuesday of the son of Spanish actors accused of killing and dismembering a Colombian surgeon on a popular tourist island.

media:content.media:text: Daniel Sancho Bronchalo
media:content.media:description: A Thai police officer escorts Spanish Daniel Sancho Bronchalo in southern Thailand on Aug. 7, 2023.

item.title: Swiss women score a landmark climate win in a court decision that could ripple across Europe
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Europe’s highest human rights court ruled Tuesday that its member nations have an obligation to protect their citizens from the ill effects of climate change, but still threw out a high-profile case brought by six Portuguese youngsters aimed at forcing countries to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

media:content.media:text: People demonstrate outside the European Court of Human Rights.
media:content.media:description: People demonstrate outside the European Court of Human Rights on April 9, 2024 in Strasbourg, France.

media:content.media:text: Greta Thunberg
media:content.media:description: Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg, left, joins youths outside the European Court of Human Rights on April 9, 2024 in Strasbourg, France.

media:content.media:text: President of the European Court of Human Rights Síofra O'Leary
media:content.media:description: President of the European Court of Human Rights Síofra O'Leary, center, on April 9, 2024 in Strasbourg, France.

item.title: Anger boils over as Russians stage rare protest after record floods
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: At least 100 Russians asked for help from President Vladimir Putin on Monday in a city struck by the worst flooding ever recorded, chanting “shame on you” at local officials who they said had done too little to help their plight.

media:content.media:text: Rescuers evacuate residents from the flooded part of the southern tip of the Ural Mountains, Russia.
media:content.media:description: Rescuers evacuate residents from the flooded part of the southern tip of the Ural Mountains, Russia on April 8, 2024.

item.title: Culinary diplomacy: The internet is obsessed with what Janet Yellen eats in China
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Since eating mushrooms that can have psychedelic effects in Beijing, Janet Yellen has united Americans and Chinese in wanting to know what she will eat next.

media:content.media:text: Janet Yellen
media:content.media:description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen, center, in Beijing last year.
